title: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
answer_1: It refers to the global object
answer_2: It refers to the current object
answer_3: It refers to the parent function
answer_4: It refers to the window object
right_answer: It refers to the current object

title: What is the difference between '==' and '==='?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
answer_1: A block of code that executes independently
answer_2: A function along with its lexical environment
answer_4: A function that doesn't return a value
right_answer: A function along with its lexical environment

title: What is hoisting in JavaScript?
answer_1: Moving all variables to the top of the code
answer_2: Moving functions to the bottom of the code
answer_3: Default behavior of moving declarations to the top
right_answer: Default behavior of moving declarations to the top

title: What is the difference between 'var', 'let', and 'const'?
answer_1: 'var' has function scope, 'let' and 'const' have block scope
answer_4: 'let' is global scope, 'var' is block scope
right_answer: 'var' has function scope, 'let' and 'const' have block scope

title: What is the purpose of JavaScript promises?
What is the purpose of the 'map' method in JavaScript?
answer_1: To create a new array by applying a function to each element
answer_2: To filter elements from an array
answer_3: To sort the elements of an array
answer_4: To reduce an array into a single value
right_answer: To create a new array by applying a function to each element

title: What is the difference between 'null' and 'undefined'?
What is event delegation?
answer_1: Attaching an event to the document object
answer_2: Using one event listener for multiple child elements
answer_3: Creating multiple event listeners for child elements
right_answer: Using one event listener for multiple child elements

title: What are JavaScript arrow functions?
answer_1: Functions that allow a shorter syntax
right_answer: Functions that allow a shorter syntax

title: What is the purpose of 'setTimeout' in JavaScript?
answer_1: To execute code at regular intervals
answer_2: To execute code after a specified delay
answer_3: To stop the execution of code
right_answer: To execute code after a specified delay

title: What is a prototype in JavaScript?
answer_2: An object linked to another object
right_answer: An object linked to another object

title: What is the 'fetch' API used for?
What is the purpose of 'async/await' in JavaScript?
What is the 'reduce' method in JavaScript?
answer_1: A method to filter elements from an array
answer_2: A method to create a new array
answer_3: A method to reduce an array into a single value
answer_4: A method to sort array elements
right_answer: A method to reduce an array into a single value
